data.enText: to make sb very interested and want to know more about sth
data.chText: 激起…的兴趣；引发…的好奇心

data.enText: You've really intrigued me─tell me more!
data.chText: 你说的真有意思——再给我讲一些吧！

data.enText: to secretly plan with other people to harm sb
data.chText: 秘密策划（加害他人）；密谋

data.enText: the activity of making secret plans in order to achieve an aim, often by tricking people
The young heroine steps into a web of intrigue in the academic world.
data.chText: 年轻的女主人公陷入了学术界钩心斗角的罗网。

data.enText: a secret plan or relationship, especially one which involves sb else being tricked
data.chText: 密谋；秘密关系；阴谋诡计

data.enText: I soon learnt about all the intrigues and scandals that went on in the little town.
data.chText: 我很快便知道了小镇上流传的种种阴谋与丑闻。

data.enText: the atmosphere of interest and excitement that surrounds sth secret or important
data.chText: 神秘气氛；引人入胜的复杂情节

simple_means.memory_skill: in- 在内,进入,使 + trig- 琐事 + -ue

tr: a crafty and involved plot to achieve your (usually sinister) ends
form intrigues (for) in an underhand manner
cause to be interested or curious

value.boxr_value: The noun is pronounced /'ɪntriːg/. The verb is pronounced /ɪn'triːg/. 名词读作 /'ɪntriːg/。动词读作 /ɪn'triːg/。

example.ex: ...a powerful story of intrigue, passion and betrayal.
example.tran: 一个关于阴谋、激情与背叛的动人心魄的故事

example.ex: ...the plots and intrigues in the novel.

value.def: Intrigue is the making of secret plans to harm or deceive people.

example.ex: The novelty of the situation intrigued him.
example.tran: 周围环境的独具一格令他着迷。

value.def: If something, especially something strange, intrigues you, it interests you and you want to know more about it.
value.tran: (尤指奇怪的事物)迷住，激起…的好奇心
